Data: 1.00pm Australia win the toss and elect to bat
Shami to Finch, no run full outside off to start, no swing, driven hard to mid-off. Not great timing.
Shami to Finch, FOUR runs creamed. Swing for Shami, overpitched and wide outside off. Finch strides forward and nails his square drive through point.
Shami to Finch, no run full delivery outside off, seaming back in, left alone

Shami to Finch, 1 run there are signs already of low bounce. Short and wide outside off, Finch cuts, his under-edge goes towards Dhoni who can't stop the ball cleanly. Bounced awkwardly in front of him too.
Shami to Warner, no run tight line, around middle and leg, defended into the leg side
Shami to Warner, no run short and wide, a touch of width, chopped into the cover region. Not going to be easy to execute cross-batted strokes with variable bounce
Yadav to Finch, no run nice start from Umesh, full and wide outside off, plenty of away shape. 133 kph, lands well short of Dhoni. Not good signs these
Yadav to Finch, no run carries at ankle height this time. Full and wide outside off, left alone. Just a hint of away shape
Yadav to Finch, 2 runs races away down to fine leg. Nothing wrong with this outfield. On the pads. and Finch flicks away down to fine leg. Shami races to his right to save two. Good running too
Yadav to Finch, 1 run a thick outside edge down to third man. Full outside off, Finch plays the line. Umesh gets some away movement
Yadav to Warner, 1 run ooh, sloppy from Kohli. Good length outside off, punched towards Kohli at cover who gets to his left but fumbles, allowing a run
Yadav to Finch, no run full and straight, skewed to midwicket with a closed bat face

Shami to Warner, FOUR runs beautiful. Just a straight bat and put away. That is the right length for the overhead conditions but the wrong length for this pitch. Full outside off, checking if there is swing. Hardly any, and Warner can drive through mid-off
Shami to Warner, 2 runs on the pads this time, adjusts his length, but the line isn't great. Clipped through square leg.
Shami to Warner, no run fullish length around middle, the perfect length, Warner doesn't know whether to come forward or go back. A thick inside edge hits his pad
Shami to Warner, no run fullish outside off, defended into the cover region
Shami to Warner, no run full on off, Warner runs at the bowler and clips him away to mid-on. Trying to put Shami off his length.

Shami to Warner, FOUR runs a thick outside edge and no catching up with that on this outfield. Full and wide, Warner plays the line, but some angle takes the ball away, taking the edge. Wide of gully and too fine for a square third man.
Yadav to Finch, no run ooh, that's tripe. Short and wide, swinging away. Finch wants to hammer through the line, without feet movement, chopped back up the pitch
Yadav to Finch, FOUR runs that's a lot, lot better. Just timed away. Short and wide, Finch watches the ball onto his bat, transfers his weight into the ball and punches his push through extra cover
Yadav to Finch, no run adjusts his line straightaway. Straighter and fullish, worked into the leg side
Yadav to Finch, FOUR runs poor delivery. India's new ball bowlers looking very rusty. A slower delivery on the pads, flicked through square leg for four. Focussed on timing, not power.
Yadav to Finch, 1 wide drifts down leg this time, wide. 137 kph, Umesh struggling. Bowling two lengths and two lines
Yadav to Finch, no run good length on middle and leg, nudged to square leg
Yadav to Finch, 1 run another awful delivery. Short and very wide, Finch can't connect cleanly with his cut, the ball trickles towards mid-off
Shami to Finch, no run full outside off, Finch drives hard into the ground towards cover
Shami to Finch, no run full and straight, pushed to mid-on. Finch wants one, but quick singles are not easy here because of the pace of the outfield.
Shami to Finch, no run excellent from Shami, much much better. Fuller than a good length is the perfect length to most batsmen, Finch in particular who likes to stay back. Defended back
Shami to Finch, no run width. Not a lot, which means Finch can only go at it with an angled bat (45 degrees as opposed to the routine 90), and finds a short point
Shami to Finch, no run terrific over so far. On a length outside off, forcing Finch to defend
Shami to Finch, no run maiden for Shami. India's best over so far. Full outside off, Finch strides forward and drives to mid-off. Found his length there, helped by a good field from Kohli/Dhoni

Yadav to Warner, FOUR runs 141 kph, Umesh is too full and as soon as it is, Warner goes over the infield. Full outside off, Warner gets under the length and lifts the ball comfortably over mid-off. Not great timing but enough
Yadav to Warner, no run drags his length back right away. That's where he should have been off the first ball. Full on off, defended towards cover
Yadav to Warner, 1 leg bye a slower ball, drifts down leg, wayward line again, 118 kph, off the pad down to fine leg
Yadav to Finch, no run good from Umesh. On a length around off, blocked back. Keep it there for the rest of the over, make Finch make the play
Yadav to Finch, no run oh no, short and wide at 127 kph, Finch doesn't find his timing but finds cover with a slap
Yadav to Finch, 1 wide drifts down leg for a wide, 130 kph
Yadav to Finch, 1 run hurries Finch for pace. A nice short ball down leg, Finch is late on his pull, gloves it down to fine leg
Shami to Finch, FOUR runs that raced away. 141 kph, full delivery on off, Finch wants to go over mid-off but the ball skews off the inside half through square leg.
Shami to Finch, 1 run Australia have respected that length, why move from there? Good length outside off, sliced towards backward point where Pandey dives to his left
Shami to Warner, FOUR runs poor delivery. Short on middle and leg, pulled away merrily through square leg. Too easy
Shami to Warner, no run 146 kph, full around off, driven away towards Kohli at cover. India chasing the game already
Shami to Warner, no run 139 kph, digs this in short on off, Warner think of pulling but bails out late.
Shami to Warner, no run a yorker to finish, 142 kph, pushed back to the bowler.
Yadav to Finch, no run late movement. Full outside off, Finch goes chasing but luckily for him, doesn't catch up with it. Beaten on the edge
Yadav to Finch, no run full outside off, defended into the cover region
Yadav to Finch, no run a slower ball around off, defended into the cover region. Dug that in, sat up
Yadav to Finch, no run good length around off, pushed away towards mid-on
Yadav to Finch, FOUR runs guided down to the third man boundary. A slower ball outside off, Finch opens his bat face and guides the ball down to the third man boundary. Nicely played
Yadav to Finch, no run full and straight, worked away to midwicket
Shami to Warner, no run a slower ball around off, driven to Kohli at cover who has an unnecessary throw at the bowler's end. Softening the ball
Shami to Warner, no run good length, around middle and off, pushed to Kohli again. No run there
Shami to Warner, no run a slower ball outside off, carved away to extra cover
Shami to Warner, no run short on middle and leg, a half pull to square leg. Well played, kept it down
Shami to Warner, 1 run a slower delivery on middle and leg, clipped to square leg
Shami to Finch, no run good length outside off, punched to cover from the crease.

Yadav to Warner, FOUR runs that was poor. Short and wide from Umesh, chopped away to point. Pandey runs to his left and lets it go, Pandya runs to his right and lets it go. The ball goes through for four.
Yadav to Warner, FOUR runs in the gap this time, short and wide outside off, powered through cover for four. Just a slap
Yadav to Warner, no run on the pads, worked away to square leg this time
Yadav to Warner, 1 run shortish outside off, pushed to mid-off for a quick single. Makes it easily
Yadav to Finch, no run 141 kph, on a length on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
Yadav to Finch, FOUR runs nicely played. Full and wide outside off, Finch just leans on a drive and sends it into the gap at cover. Fantastic timing
Axar Patel to Warner, no run flat and wide to start, pushed to cover from the crease
Axar Patel to Warner, no run quick outside off, watchfully defended into the cover region
Axar Patel to Warner, no run short outside off, driven towards cover. No turn.
Axar Patel to Warner, no run runs at Axar this time, but the length is terrific, worked to midwicket from the crease
Axar Patel to Warner, 1 run short outside off, sits up for Warner to push to long-off
Axar Patel to Finch, no run short on middle and off, driven back to the bowler from the crease
Hardik to Warner, 1 wide wow, that was waaay down leg, wide. Dhoni saved four by moving quickly
Hardik to Warner, 1 run short and wide outside off, nailed away to the sweeper cover
Hardik to Finch, FOUR runs beautifully played. A shortish delivery outside off, not very pacey, Finch stands back and drills a drive through cover. No chance for the sweeper cover running around
Hardik to Finch, 1 run a shortish delivery on the pads, nudged to midwicket
Hardik to Warner, 1 run superbly hit, but mid-off does well. Good length outside off, pushed through cover, Umesh runs around to his right
Hardik to Finch, no run 133 kph, good length outside off, defended
Hardik to Finch, 1 run smashed through cover again, a slower delivery. The cover fielder gets around this time
Axar Patel to Finch, 1 run full outside off, stabbed into the cover region for one. Nice timing
Axar Patel to Warner, 1 run quick outside off, darted in, driven to long-off
Axar Patel to Finch, 1 run short on middle and leg, pushed to long-on for a run
Axar Patel to Warner, no run quick outside off, still no turn, played towards point
Axar Patel to Warner, FOUR runs poor delivery. Short and wide this time from Axar, Warner races back and nails his cut through point
Axar Patel to Warner, 1 run on the pads, easily worked towards square leg
Hardik to Warner, no run drifts on the pads again, Warner misses some runs, off the pad to short fine leg
Hardik to Warner, no run full and straight, the ball moving in, driven back to the bowler
Hardik to Warner, 1 wide another poor delivery, starts it too straight, drifts down leg. Dhoni stops the ball but rolls over it as he falls over. Ouch
Hardik to Warner, 1 run short and wide outside off, slashed to the deep point fielder
Hardik to Finch, no run good length around off, outside-edged towards point
Hardik to Finch, 1 run good length delivery outside off, nicely hit through point for one. Sweeper cover runs around
Hardik to Warner, 1 run good length outside off, punched away to the sweeper cover for one
Axar Patel to Warner, no run flat and straight again, nudged to midwicket
Axar Patel to Warner, no run short outside off, defended watchfully. Tight lines these from Axar
Axar Patel to Warner, no run the big reverse sweep. Flat on middle, Warner switches his stance, not his hands, finds third man
Axar Patel to Warner, SIX runs picks the length early and smashed. Short on middle, Warner picks the length early and nails his pull over midwicket. Six
Axar Patel to Warner, FOUR runs that's Warner's fifty. Short and wide from Axar, Warner sits back and crashes a cut through point. Too easy
Axar Patel to Warner, no run clipped to midwicket
Hardik to Finch, 1 run good length outside off, driven towards cover for a tight run
Hardik to Warner, 2 runs on the pads, flicked away through midwicket for a couple more
Hardik to Warner, 1 run a slower wide delivery outside off, cut away towards extra cover for a run
Hardik to Finch, 1 run a slower ball outside off, driven to the sweeper cover
Hardik to Warner, no run another slow straight delivery, driven away to cover
Hardik to Warner, 1 run short and wide, slashed down to third man for one
Chahal to Warner, no run full and straight, pushed back to the bowler
Chahal to Warner, 1 run shortish around off, pulled down to long-on
Chahal to Finch, 1 leg bye short down leg, off the pad down to short fine leg. Already going on the defensive in terms of flight
Chahal to Warner, no run short outside off, pushed away to cover
Chahal to Warner, 1 run lots of flight on that outside off, driven to long-off
Chahal to Finch, no run good end, quick on leg, pushed back to the bowler and that will be drinks

Hardik to Warner, FOUR runs overpitched on off stump, and that's a good stop from Umesh at long-off, sprinting hard and sliding to his left after Warner shows it the full face and sends it racing towards the boundary. Is it a clean save, or has his foot touched the rope? Replays indicate it's the latter. Still, a good effort from the fast bowler
Hardik to Warner, no run back of a length, angling across towards off stump, chopped down towards short cover
Hardik to Warner, 1 run full, a fair bit outside off stump this time. Warner eases it away towards deep point after shuffling across
Hardik to Finch, 2 runs full, a lot of width, Finch throws his hands at it and opens his bat face slightly to get the placement he desires, a fair distance to the left of Axar at sweeper cover
Hardik to Finch, no run length ball outside off stump, presses forward to drive towards cover. Was in the air for a moment, but he was more or less in control of his shot

Hardik to Finch, 1 run goes wide of the crease to angle a length ball towards off stump. Finch shows the full face and pushes it down the ground, past the diving bowler, and mid-off moves right to stop it
Chahal to Finch, 1 wide flat, angling down leg. Finch can't get bat on it as he tries to glance
Chahal to Finch, 1 run back of a length, angling into the pads, tucked away to the left of short fine leg
Chahal to Warner, SIX runs tossed up on leg stump, and Warner gets down low, front leg planted just next to the line, to slog-sweep hard and flat over midwicket
Chahal to Warner, no run quicker ball on middle and off, defended without too much footwork back to the bowler

Chahal to Warner, 2 runs goes back to a length ball that's only inches outside off stump and plays a controlled cut through cover point. Most batsmen would have played that off the front foot, into the covers
Chahal to Warner, no run slows it down and gets some turn, rips in and hits the pad as he comes half-forward to defend. Clearly headed down leg, so not much of an appeal
Chahal to Warner, 1 run flat, back of a length, goes back and works it off his pads through square leg
Axar Patel to Warner, no run back of a length, turning in towards middle and off, defended to midwicket
Axar Patel to Warner, no run length ball, goes on the back foot again, Axar gives him no room and he clips towards midwicket
Axar Patel to Warner, no run a bit slower on off stump, gets forward to push down the ground, towards long-on, and Axar moves quickly to his left to intercept
Axar Patel to Warner, 1 run down the track now, gets to the pitch of a slightly tossed-up off-stump ball and whips to long-on
Axar Patel to Finch, no run length ball angled in towards off stump, slightly lower arm on this. Defended towards point

Axar Patel to Finch, no run flat, and he goes back, plays the trajectory rather than the actual length, which isn't short enough to pull. Inside-edges it and drags it a short distance into the leg side. Could easily have played on there

Chahal to Warner, SIX runs down the track and that's six more. Not much Chahal can do about this. He looked to bowl it a little shorter, at his body, and not give him swinging room, and he just clears his front leg and swats it away over square midwicket
Chahal to Warner, 1 run full on off stump, driven to long-off

Chahal to Finch, 1 run length ball pitching on middle and turning away, makes room and slaps it away to sweeper cover, past Kohli, who moves to his left from extra-cover but doesn't get down in time to stop it
Chahal to Warner, 2 runs a tiny bit of width, and Warner makes a bit more room and slaps it away, off the back foot, through backward point
Chahal to Warner, no run flat on the pads, clipped to midwicket
Chahal to Warner, 1 run tossed up slower, lands on a good length on middle stump and turns into Warner, who gets forward to work it through square leg
Axar Patel to Warner, no run flat length ball on off stump, goes back and across to work it to square leg
Axar Patel to Warner, no run down the track to one bowled slightly slower on off stump. Doesn't get to the pitch, punches it back to the bowler

Axar Patel to Warner, no run fired in flat, angling slightly down leg. Nowhere near short enough to pull - he was looking to turn it around the corner with a horizontal-ish bat - and he's hit on the pad. Not the loudest lbw appeal, he knew it was heading down leg
Axar Patel to Warner, 1 run flat again, on the stumps, clipped down the ground to long-on
Axar Patel to Finch, no run flat length ball on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
Axar Patel to Finch, no run angled in with a lower arm, pitches just back of a length. Goes back to punch to short cover
Chahal to Warner, 1 run back of a length outside off, chopped down towards backward point

Chahal to Finch, 4 byes Finch misses, Dhoni misses, and that runs away for four byes. Looked to clear his front leg and launch that over mid-on, and the ball turned less than he expected. Went between bat and pad, and his back leg dragged itself out of the crease. The lack of turn has beaten Dhoni too - a missed stumping.
Chahal to Finch, no run length ball on off stump, driven to short cover
Chahal to Finch, no run flat length ball on middle stump, blocked back towards the bowler
Chahal to Finch, 1 run on the pads, clipped quietly towards backward square leg
Chahal to Warner, 1 run short, wide, slapped to deep point
Axar Patel to Warner, no run flat length ball on leg stump - he saw Warner setting up to make himself room. Punched into the covers
Axar Patel to Warner, 1 wide now he expects Warner to make that premeditated movement and fires it down the leg side. Warner stays where he is and it's called wide

Axar Patel to Warner, no run fired in flat again. Warner moves away from the stumps first, and then moves across to try and play a half-forward sweep. Misses. is hit on the pad, but it's going down leg
Axar Patel to Warner, no run flat length ball on middle stump, clipped towards midwicket
Axar Patel to Warner, 1 run a touch shorter outside off, chopped into the covers
Axar Patel to Finch, no run
Axar Patel to Finch, no run back of a length on middle stump, defended to midwicket
Chahal to Warner, no run steps out but goes too early. Chahal tosses it wide of off stump and he reaches out to stab it to backward point
Chahal to Warner, 1 run length ball, closer to off stump, punched down the ground to long-off
Chahal to Finch, no run tossed up on the pads, lands very full. Clipped to short fine leg

Chahal to Finch, 2 runs sees Finch looking to make room and slows it up a lot, floats it up gently. Doesn't have the pace to go over cover, so drags a sweep out to deep square leg instead, brings up fifty
Chahal to Finch, no run flat, back of a length on leg stump, cramps Finch for room and he punches to short extra

Chahal to Finch, no run again Finch makes a premeditated move away from leg stump. Slows it up gently and follows him outside leg. Not full enough for the drive so he looks to defend, and the ball turns past his outside edge and somehow misses leg stump.
Axar Patel to Warner, no run flat, fired down leg. Looks to clip it round the corner, misses. Big appeal from Dhoni - maybe a bit of pad on the way through
Axar Patel to Warner, 1 run flat and full on off stump, clipped through square leg

Axar Patel to Finch, SIX runs full on off stump, and Finch finally executes a shot he's been trying to play for a while. Unlike Chahal, Axar gives him some pace to work with, and he makes just a bit of room to loft that inside-out over cover
Axar Patel to Finch, 1 run flat, back of a length, angling into middle stump. Makes a bit of room and punches it past the diving bowler to long-off
Axar Patel to Warner, 1 run again, looks to cramp Warner by firing it flat onto his pads. Makes room and punches to long-off
Axar Patel to Finch, FOUR runs flat, angling down leg, and it's a touch short too. Finch just needs a little bit of bat on this, and he manages it, just helps it away down to the fine leg boundary
Chahal to Warner, 1 run tossed up outside off. Stretches out and plays a wristy flick-sweep through backward square leg
Chahal to Finch, FOUR runs floats this down the leg side, and that's not a great ball with fine leg up. Sweeps it in the air, to the left of that fielder, and picks up four more
Chahal to Finch, 1 run back of a length, pitching on off stump and turning away. Stops on Finch slightly as he goes on the back foot. Adjusts and whips it down to long-on
Chahal to Warner, no run tossed up outside off. Gets on the front foot and clips to short fine leg, with the turn
Chahal to Warner, 1 run back of a length, turning in towards off and middle. Chopped away into the cover-point region

Chahal to Finch, SIX runs flighted, and it's not the greatest ball. Lands right in Finch's slot outside off, gives him ample room to swing freely through the line and launch it cleanly over the long-off boundary
Hardik to Warner, no run length ball outside off, opens his bat face and steers to backward point
Hardik to Warner, 1 run back of a length, angling in towards off stump, pushes gently into the covers and calls his partner through for a single

Hardik to Finch, 1 leg bye back of a length, a bit of inward nip too as Finch walks across, looking to work it into the leg side. Misses, hit on the pad, but it's probably a touch high. Not much of an appeal as it runs away into the square-leg region for a leg bye

Hardik to Warner, 2 runs back of a length close to off stump, punched away to the right of Rahane at deep point. Bit of a misfield, the result of the batsmen putting pressure on him by pushing for two
Hardik to Warner, 1 run length ball close to off stump, punched down the ground to long-off
Hardik to Finch, 1 run slower length ball angling in towards off stump. Presses forward, lets it come on, and dabs into the backward point region
Chahal to Finch, no run back of a length on the pads, clipped to short fine leg
Chahal to Finch, 1 run flat, short, wide, slapped to the left of deep point
Chahal to Warner, no run back of a length, sharp turn in from wide of off, punched into the covers
Chahal to Warner, no run tossed up along that wide line again. Chases it with the attempted flat-bat drive and inside-edges into the ground and then towards the keeper. Again some turn from that line
Chahal to Warner, 1 run shorter now, slapped away to deep point
Chahal to Finch, 1 run back of a length on middle stump, punched to long-on

Axar Patel to Finch, FOUR runs shot! That's a flat length ball angled into middle and leg, not much turn. Just gets down low, leaning backwards to make a bit more room, and helps it away with a flat bat to the left of short fine leg
Axar Patel to Finch, 1 run length ball, looks to get forward and play down the ground, gets a little inside edge that rolls into the leg side
Axar Patel to Warner, no run length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
Axar Patel to Warner, no run tossed up higher on off stump, driven hard but straight back to the bowler

Axar Patel to Warner, 2 runs on the pads, tucked away through backward square leg. Throw from Shami, who runs in from the boundary, hits the stumps on the full at the bowler's end, and deflects away for an overthrow
Axar Patel to Warner, 1 run back of a length, turns in towards the pads, worked away through square leg
Jadhav to Warner, 1 run back of a length, angling into off stump, flat-batted down to long-off for one
Jadhav to Finch, no run ooh, that's a round-arm Malinga outswinger at the speed of a jalopy. Looks to punch into the covers, with no feet, and the ball beats his outside edge
Jadhav to Finch, 1 run this one's angling down leg and short fine leg dives right to stop a firm, standing sweep. Hardik the fielder
Jadhav to Warner, no run shortish outside off, slapped straight to backward point.

Jadhav to Warner, FOUR runs round-arm, very wide of off, and he takes a big step back and across and stabs it away to the right of the diving backward point to bring up his 14th ODI hundred. What a way to celebrate your 100th ODI.
Jadhav to Warner, no run back of a length on off stump, punched to extra-cover. Wanted the single to long-off, but Rohit dived left to intercept
Axar Patel to Finch, 2 runs back of a length outside off, punched to the left of sweeper cover
Axar Patel to Finch, 1 run back of a length on off stump, punched to sweeper cover
Axar Patel to Warner, 1 run down the track and Axar looks to cramp him by firing it at his pads. Flicks it round to short fine leg
Axar Patel to Finch, no run length ball wide of off, a bit slower. Early into the flat-bat slap and he hits it to extra-cover
Axar Patel to Finch, 1 run back of a length this time, and he doesn't quite get the room he wants. Again a flat-bat slap straight to extra-cover
Axar Patel to Warner, 1 run back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room to flat-bat to long-off
Jadhav to Warner, no run flat, angling into the pads, clipped to square leg
Jadhav to Warner, 1 run slow, round-arm, short and wide. It's absolutely filthy but all he can do with it is slap it to deep point
Jadhav to Finch, no run slow again, angling down leg. Sweeps hard, and ends up hitting straight to short fine leg
Jadhav to Finch, 1 run fuller, on the pads, swept to the left of short fine leg but deep backward square leg is pretty fine too, just has to move a short distance to his right to stop it
Jadhav to Warner, no run back of a length outside off, slapped to extra-cover
Jadhav to Warner, 1 run again flat and short, slapped to the left of sweeper cover
Axar Patel to Warner, no run shortish, wide of off, slapped to point

Axar Patel to Warner, SIX runs flat, full, angling into leg stump, and Warner's hit the roof! Just clears his front leg and swings his entire body through a mighty swipe over wide long-on. It was this close to clearing the roof and going out of the ground
Axar Patel to Warner, 2 runs back of a length outside off, slapped away through cover

Axar Patel to Warner, FOUR runs flat length ball wide of off, and he goes on the back foot - most batsmen would have gone forward to that - and flat-bats it with immense power to beat sweeper cover diving futilely to his left
Axar Patel to Warner, no run quicker ball, short and well wide of off stump. Jumps across to cut but can't connect

Axar Patel to Warner, FOUR runs shortish, closer to off stump this time, and Warner puts it away clinically. Waits on it, and then chops it away at the perfect moment to place it unstoppably to the right of the overworked off-side sweeper
Jadhav to Finch, SIX runs round-arm, full, angling into the pads. Finch clears his front leg and slogs it away powerfully over midwicket
Jadhav to Finch, 1 run back of a length on middle and leg, punched down the ground to long-on
Jadhav to Warner, no run full outside off, driven hard to extra-cover
Jadhav to Warner, 1 run tossed up full on off stump, driven to long-off
Jadhav to Finch, 1 run back of a length on off stump. Makes a bit of room and flat-bats down the ground to long-off

Jadhav to Warner, OUT flat, shortish, angling into leg stump, and Jadhav has broken the partnership! The low release means there isn't too much bounce. Clears his front leg and looks to heave it over wide long-on, but it skids on and he hits it straighter than he'd like, and doesn't get the power he'd like, ends up hitting it straight to long-on
Yadav to Finch, no run good length outside off, driven on the up to cover, stays on the back foot
Yadav to Finch, no run on a length, the ball seaming back in, worked away to midwicket
Yadav to Finch, no run a slower delivery outside off, pushed away towards cover. Another dot, three in a row
Yadav to Finch, no run on the pads, Finch misses a flick, clips the pad en route to the keeper. Too leg side ish

Yadav to Finch, OUT looks to clobber it, such bad timing that mid-on takes a sitter. A slower ball outside off, Finch looks to drag the ball from well outside off, but it's right off the toe end, and straight to mid-on. So wide that it may have been a wide had Finch let that go
Yadav to Smith, 1 run gets a gentle full toss on the pads and Smith works the ball through square leg. Great over from Umesh
Jadhav to Smith, 1 run slow, slingy arm down leg, a fine tickle down to fine leg for a run
Jadhav to Head, no run shortish outside off, Head stays back and pushes the ball back to the bowler
Jadhav to Head, no run tossed up outside off, driven away towards Kohli at cover, who stops it the ball with a dive to his right
Jadhav to Head, 1 run short and wide outside off, chopped away to long-off
Jadhav to Smith, no run flat and straight, skids on, nudged to square leg
Jadhav to Smith, 1 wide Smith backs away, then gets back inside the line, Jadhav follows him and concedes the wide
Jadhav to Smith, 1 run short outside off, punched to long-on from the crease

Yadav to Smith, OUT chipped into the hands of midwicket. Australia are falling apart quickly. On the pads from Umesh, Smith gets outside the line and just clips it into the hands of midwicket, where Kohli is lurking. This game turning around quickly again
Yadav to Handscomb, 2 runs nicely whipped away. Too straight from Umesh and Handscomb flicks away past midwicket for a couple. Played that along the ground
Yadav to Handscomb, 1 run full and straight again, nudged down to fine leg for one
Yadav to Head, no run good length outside off, pushed back to the bowler. Tidy line
Yadav to Head, no run full and straight, pushed back to the bowler

4.58pm All in all, that's quite a fine innings from Australia. But depending on which camp you are in, you'd be a little disappointed or slightly happy with that total of 334. When Warner and Finch were going, it looked like Australia were set for 360, maybe more. But India pulled it back nicely in the end through wickets. These are short boundaries, and a decent surface, and a fine batting unit.

Zampa to Hardik, 1 run looks to go over cover this time, but the ball drifts on, takes the inside half and makes its way to long-on
Zampa to Jadhav, 1 run fine stop from Richardson at third man. Short and wide, Jadhav cuts that into the gap. The fielder saves three
Zampa to Hardik, SIX runs clears midwicket. It's just slightly short outside off, Pandya stays in his crease and nails his whipped jab over midwicket. How did he get so much power behind that?

Zampa to Hardik, SIX runs and again. Zampa bowls this wider outside off, tempting Pandya, who says I have a wide repertoire and drills a hard drive over cover. Keeps going and clears the boundary easily
Zampa to Hardik, no run flat end, towards off, dabbed towards point
Cummins to Jadhav, 1 run good length on the pads, nudged down to fine leg for a run
Cummins to Hardik, no run full outside off, defended towards cover
Cummins to Hardik, no run on the pads, 146 kph, seams back in. Pandya gets to the ball late, and is clattered on the thigh pad, just under the actual protection.
Cummins to Hardik, no run good length outside off, carved towards backward point
Cummins to Hardik, 1 run full outside off, pushed away towards extra cover for one. Think he feels he is set
Cummins to Jadhav, no run beauty. Full delivery outside off, the ball seams away or holds its line, beaten on the outside edge as Jadhav plays the line
Stoinis to Hardik, 1 run full and wide outside off, Pandya leans into his drive for a run to the sweeper cover
Stoinis to Jadhav, no run good length outside off, tapped to backward point
Stoinis to Jadhav, FOUR runs 131 kph, short on middle, sits up for Jadhav to merrily pull over midwicket for four. Easy as ... Poor ball
Stoinis to Jadhav, no run Smith stops a run again. Full and wide outside off, guided to backward point where Smith dives away to his left to save another run.
Stoinis to Jadhav, 1 run full outside off, Jadhav has a leaden-footed drive at that and gets one to midwicket
Stoinis to Hardik, 1 run finely played. Good length outside off, a deft dab to third man. Pandya wants two and Jadhav doesn't. At least, it was a loud clear call
Cummins to Hardik, 1 run good length outside off, a dab down to third man for one
Cummins to Jadhav, no run good length outside off, played to Smith at backward point
Cummins to Jadhav, 1 run full around off, Jadhav comes down the pitch and shovels a flick to square leg for one
Cummins to Hardik, no run a short slow delivery outside off, Pandya tries to dab that down again but makes no connection. Cummins hurrying these two
Cummins to Hardik, 2 wide drifts down leg this time. Bounces awkwardly in front of Wade, who half-stops it. Good from Jadhav to steal the bye

Cummins to Jadhav, FOUR runs a thick under-edged past the keeper and into the boundary. Short and wide outside off, Jadhav is late on the ball but gets enough bat to beat the keeper. Finch runs around from third man but can't quite haul it in
Cummins to Jadhav, 1 run full outside off, a thick outside edge towards Smith at point, a half-stop again, one run
Stoinis to Jadhav, no run full outside off, driven back to the bowler
Stoinis to Jadhav, 1 run shortish around off, Jadhav gets an under-edge on his pull towards square leg
Stoinis to Hardik, 1 run good length outside off, a thick outside edge down to third man.
Stoinis to Jadhav, no run comes down the pitch, looking to hit that straight but the ball skews off the inside edge into the pad
Stoinis to Jadhav, FOUR runs that will be four. 131 kph, short on off, hammered through square leg with a terrific pull, played that early and fine enough for four behind square.
Stoinis to Jadhav, FOUR runs four more. Short and wide outside off, Jadhav nails his cut behind point for another boundary. Fantastic placement from Jadhav
Cummins to Hardik, 1 run full outside off, driven up to Warner at mid-off, good single from these two
Cummins to Jadhav, no run full outside off, played down quietly towards point
Cummins to Jadhav, no run fullish around off, the ball comes back in, defended back. Nice line
Cummins to Jadhav, no run full around off, worked away to mid-on, the ball coming back in again
Cummins to Jadhav, no run good length outside off, played down to point. Another dot. Fantastic bowling from Cummins
Cummins to Jadhav, 1 wide strays down the leg side, another wide, another extra
Cummins to Jadhav, 1 run shortish and wide outside off, a calm dab down to third man for one
Stoinis to Jadhav, no run full outside off, defended back
Stoinis to Jadhav, 1 run full and straight, whipped away to deep square leg for one
Stoinis to Hardik, 1 run good length outside off, skewed away off the outside half to deep point

Stoinis to Jadhav, SIX runs lovely shot from Jadhav. Comes down to Stoinis, it's full and wide, and Jadhav goes through with the stroke. clean swing through the line, way over long-off. Superb hit from Jadhav
Stoinis to Jadhav, no run full outside off, defended back this time
Stoinis to Jadhav, 1 run on the pads this time and Jadhav flicks him away through square leg for one.

Kane Richardson to Jadhav, 1 run length ball angling in towards off stump, defended towards point and they sprint through for a quick single. That man Smith has dived in and flicked a direct hit at the keeper's end, but Pandya was well home by then
Kane Richardson to Hardik, FOUR runs overpitched on leg stump, and Pandya just needs to place that. He does that nicely, flicks it away into the big gap to the left of long leg
Kane Richardson to Hardik, no run slower ball outside off, and it beats Pandya, who opens his bat face and looks to guide it down to third man
Kane Richardson to Hardik, no run back of a length close to off stump. Looks for the pushed single but extra-cover charges forward, towards the ball to deny him
Kane Richardson to Hardik, no run back of a length outside off, dabbed to short third man - was maybe looking to beat him to his left
Kane Richardson to Hardik, no run length ball on off stump, punched to short extra-cover
Zampa to Jadhav, no run slowly tossed up on off stump, turning away. Jadhav is too early into his sweep and the ball hits his hip
Zampa to Jadhav, no run goes back to a length ball turning from leg to off. Defends into the off side
Zampa to Jadhav, no run back of a length on middle stump, pushed through flat. Clipped towards midwicket
Zampa to Jadhav, no run flighty full-toss on off stump, driven straight to short extra-cover
Zampa to Jadhav, 1 run he doesn't throw it up. It's flat and shortish outside off, and Jadhav slaps it to deep point
Zampa to Hardik, 1 run flat length ball on middle and leg, shows the full face to push down to long-on
Kane Richardson to Hardik, no run ooh, not the right length. Back of a length, fourth-stump line. Bounces over his outside edge as he clears his front leg and tries to launch it over mid-on
Kane Richardson to Hardik, 1 run back of a length, angling into the body, tucked off the hip to the left of fine leg
Kane Richardson to Jadhav, 1 run shuffles across to off stump and Richardson responds with a full ball on middle. Clipped to deep square leg
Kane Richardson to Hardik, 1 run length ball on middle and off, driven to long-on

Kane Richardson to Jadhav, 1 run back of a length outside off, Jadhav shuffles forward even before the bowler releases, opens his bat face, and stabs to backward point. He's right on the edge of the circle, so they run a fairly comfortable single
Kane Richardson to Hardik, 1 run fullish on off stump, and this time mid-off is right on the edge of the 30-yard circle, so they run a single despite Pandya driving straight to the man
Zampa to Pandey, 1 run shortish, close to off stump, goes back to chop it to the right of backward point and gets off the mark first ball
Zampa to Jadhav, no run wide length ball, slapped to backward point
Zampa to Jadhav, no run flatter, on off stump, gets on the front foot and dabs towards backward point

Zampa to Jadhav, no run ooh, good ball. And they've gone to the third umpire for a stumping appeal! Goes back to a length ball and he's beaten trying to late-cut. A bit of extra bounce on that. He didn't move out of the crease, but momentarily moved his back foot forward - he dragged it rather than lift it, however, and he's pretty much safe
Zampa to Jadhav, 1 run tossed up on off stump, gets down low to drag a slog-sweep along the ground to the left of deep square leg
Coulter-Nile to Jadhav, no run sees Jadhav stepping out and bowls it short outside off. Hops to ride the bounce, and dabs towards backward point
Coulter-Nile to Jadhav, FOUR runs down the track again, and this time he gets the length he wants. Just back of a length, and he plays a front-foot swipe into the gap between mid-on and midwicket

Coulter-Nile to Jadhav, no run down the track again. This time he shortens his length and angles it into the body, cramping Jadhav for room. Drops it down into the pitch with soft hands, but no chance of a quick single
Coulter-Nile to Jadhav, 1 run shuffles out of his crease again, and this time he gets the wide length ball, which he guides down to third man with an open bat face

Coulter-Nile to Pandey, 1 leg bye shortish, angling into the body, and he tucks it off his hip into the square leg region. Loses his footing as he sets off for a single, and he stumbles onto the floor and loses his bat before finally managing to jog to the other end
Coulter-Nile to Jadhav, no run length ball outside off, pushed towards extra-cover

Zampa to Pandey, no run goes back to a length ball on middle and off, and it straightens rather than turn away sharply. Jams his bat down to defend into the off side - it was very nearly back pad before bat
Zampa to Pandey, FOUR runs bad ball. Tosses it up and ends up bowling a knee-high full-toss. Clears his front leg and swats it away to the forward square leg boundary
Zampa to Pandey, 1 run tossed up outside off, driven with a wristy whip to sweeper cover
Zampa to Jadhav, 1 run tossed up full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
Zampa to Pandey, 1 run again some flight, full outside off, driven in the air, on the bounce, to long-off
Zampa to Jadhav, no run length ball on middle stump, presses forward and blocks back towards the bowler
Coulter-Nile to Pandey, no run back of a length outside off, flat-batted to mid-off
Coulter-Nile to Pandey, 1 run fullish outside off, and Pandey plays a checked drive - he almost seemed to pull out of the shot - and ends up getting a thick outside edge down to third man
Coulter-Nile to Jadhav, 1 run there he goes again, striding out of his crease. Coulter-Nile digs it in short outside off, and he lets it come on and dabs to third man
Coulter-Nile to Pandey, no run length ball angling into middle stump, clipped to midwicket
Coulter-Nile to Pandey, 1 run back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and jabs to the right of backward point

Coulter-Nile to Jadhav, FOUR runs shot! Down the track again and now Coulter-Nile bowls it in his area, full and angling into off stump. Brings his wrists into play to whip it away to the right of midwicket and bring up his fifty

Zampa to Pandey, FOUR runs down the track comes Pandey, and Zampa is under pressure at the start of the over. Some flight, wide of off stump, and he gets underneath it and drives inside-out over cover

Zampa to Pandey, 1 leg bye a touch short, angling down leg. Not short enough to pull. Looks to help it fine but can't put bat to ball. Only hits his upraised front pad, and rolls away for a leg bye towards fine leg. Belatedly, Smith as decided to review for lbw, but no way is that lbw. I haven't even seen the replays,and I know impact was outside leg stump and it was missing leg by a lon
Zampa to Jadhav, 1 run full on middle and leg, clipped to the left of short fine leg
Zampa to Pandey, 1 run flat, short, and he goes deep in his crease to whip-pull to deep backward square leg. Wasn't quite short enough for the full-blooded arms-extended pull
Zampa to Jadhav, 1 run down the track and it's too flat and quick to get any elevation. Drags his slog along the ground to deep midwicket

Zampa to Pandey, FOUR runs down the track again, and this time Pandey puts it away. A difficult shot, because he fired it flat and full at his feet, and he had to quickly get his front leg out of the way to bring his bat down. He manages that, and whips it away hard, so hard it beats long-on's desperate dive to his right

Coulter-Nile to Jadhav, 2 runs bouncer, and Jadhav isn't in a great position for the hook. Needs to meet it above his right shoulder. Loops up in the air but falls safely in front of the man coming in from the long leg boundary. They manage to run two as well
Coulter-Nile to Jadhav, 1 run length ball, and he uses his wrists to meet that on a fourth-stump line and whip it through backward square leg

Coulter-Nile to Pandey, SIX runs wham! That's full on off stump, and he's cleared his front foot and simply flicked it over the midwicket boundary. What a shot that is! Almost a helicopter shot, without the full flourishing Dhoni finish
Coulter-Nile to Pandey, 1 run full on off stump again, jabbed down to long-on for one
Coulter-Nile to Jadhav, no run walks across towards off stump and a step down the pitch as well. Clips the off-stump length ball to midwicket
Coulter-Nile to Jadhav, no run down the track once more and Coulter-Nile sends down a clever slower short ball. Through his pull too soon and it hits him on the right hip
Kane Richardson to Pandey, no run starts with a slower ball, full and just outside off. Looks to squeeze it square through point, but can't connect
Kane Richardson to Pandey, 1 run full on off stump, pushed down the ground to long-off, another slower ball
Kane Richardson to Jadhav, 1 run back of a length angling into off stump, pushed to the right of extra-cover with a straight bat, another single
Kane Richardson to Pandey, 1 run full outside off, stabbed to deep point
Kane Richardson to Jadhav, 1 run well bowled. Saw Jadhav shuffling across to off stump and sent down a yorker right by his toes.Jams his bat down to squeeze it out to long-on
Kane Richardson to Pandey, 1 run full-toss, stump-high, on off stump. Makes a bit of room and dabs to the right of backward point, where Head makes a good diving stop

Cummins to Pandey, 2 runs shortish, close to off stump, makes some room and slaps it away to the left of deep point. Placed it sufficiently wide of that fielder to pick up two. Coulter-Nile was the man in the deep - he moved a little late, because initially it looked like Handscomb would move right from backward point and stop it, but he didn't quite reach the ball
Cummins to Pandey, 1 run back of a length close to off stump, dabbed down to third man
Cummins to Jadhav, FOUR runs short, wide, and cracked away. Such fast hands, and it screams away to the right of the diving backward point fielder

Cummins to Jadhav, no run set himself up for a similar ball, going deep in his crease with his back foot. Cummins cramped him for room this time, angling a back-of-a-length ball in towards middle stump. Chops it down into the pitch
Cummins to Jadhav, no run excellent bowling. This time Jadhav stepped out of his crease, and he nails a yorker right at his feet. Jams down to keep it out
Cummins to Jadhav, 1 leg bye out of his crease again and he gets a bit of inward nip with this back-of-a-length ball. Sneaks under the attempted horizontal-bat swat and hits his pad, high up
Kane Richardson to Jadhav, 1 run full-toss on off stump, flat-batted down to long-off
Kane Richardson to Pandey, 1 run now Richardson nails a yorker, on middle and leg. Gets his feet out of the way and stabs it away into the point region

Kane Richardson to Jadhav, 2 runs slower ball, full and wide, dragged down the ground to long-on. Wanted the big slog but it was too full to get any elevation. The throw at the bowler's end, from Warner, is fumbled by Richardson, and they sneak an overthrow

Kane Richardson to Pandey, 1 run down the track, making himself a bit of room. Doesn't quite nail the yorker and it's a driveable full ball on off stump. Drilled down the ground powerfully, but long-off moves quickly to his right to ensure it doesn't go for four
Kane Richardson to Dhoni, 2 runs full on middle and leg, clipped away through square leg and the batsmen hurry through for two
Cummins to Axar Patel, 1 run length ball slanting across towards off stump. Pushes at it uncertainly, his feet aren't quite moving yet, and gets an outside edge down to third man

Cummins to Dhoni, FOUR runs back of a length, angling down leg, and Dhoni tucks it away fine, too fine for the man at fine leg to stop. Don't know if Cummins was a little put off by Dhoni's initial movement across the stumps
Cummins to Dhoni, no run down the track and he has an almighty heave across this short ball. Inside-edges past leg stump, and Wade throws himself to his left to stop it
Cummins to Dhoni, no run short, rising ball. Too close to off stump to cut, and he's off his feet and he inside-edges down into the ground, not far from off stump
Cummins to Dhoni, 1 run again a big step across his stumps. Cummins digs it in, just back of a length, angling into the body, and Dhoni swivels to pull to long leg
Kane Richardson to Dhoni, no run shortish, too close to off stump to get the kind of power he wants with the cut. Straight to backward point
Kane Richardson to Dhoni, no run slower ball wide of off stump, flat-batted hard but straight to extra-cover

Kane Richardson to Dhoni, no run slower ball, fullish outside off. Another huge slog from Dhoni, loses his shape, and nearly inside-edges into his off stump. Wade dives left to make sure it doesn't run away behind him
Kane Richardson to Dhoni, SIX runs short outside off, and Dhoni's flat-batted it for six! Finally gets some leverage, some width, and he just slaps it away over the covers
Kane Richardson to Shami, no run slower short ball, angling down leg. Not the greatest of balls to bowl with fine leg inside the circle, but Shami only manages to swat it straight to that fielder
Cummins to Axar Patel, 1 run length ball on middle and off, only manages to push towards extra cover and pick up one
Cummins to Shami, 1 run back of a length on middle stump. Moves away from leg stump to make room to swipe down to long-on
Cummins to Axar Patel, no run back of a length, angling across towards middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
Cummins to Axar Patel, 2 runs shortish on leg stump, tucked away towards deep square leg
Cummins to Axar Patel, 1 run back of a length on leg stump. Looks to whip it against the angle, gets a leading edge that loops up and drops into no-man's land in front of deep square leg running in
Cummins to Shami, no run sees him backing away from the stumps and sends down a yorker that doesn't miss leg stump by much, after Shami jabs at it in vain
Coulter-Nile to Yadav, 1 run length ball outside off, slashed to sweeper cover
Coulter-Nile to Shami, 1 run full on middle stump, swiped down to long-on
Coulter-Nile to Yadav, 1 run full on off stump, whipped in the air, on the bounce, to midwicket

Coulter-Nile to Shami, FOUR runs shot. Waist-high full-toss on middle and leg, and he moves away from the stumps to make a bit of swinging room and club it away over midwicket. The umpire suggests it's just below waist high
Coulter-Nile to Shami, no run back of a length outside off, Shami swings and misses, looking for the big drive over the covers
